item.title: 100 errors while complying
item.dc:creator: @DivineSouls DivineSouls
item.description:
@DivineSouls wrote:

[quote=“jabezxa, post:5, topic:365360”][quote author=Rixxx link=topic=461566.msg3376576#msg3376576 date=1287668882]
It’s also called ‘compiling’, not ‘complying’.
[/quote]
Well, I don’t really ‘CARE’, ‘I’m just cool so i have to use grammar all the time’ ‘And every word has to be correct’ Fuck it would suck if you were talking to an Asian that can’t talk English.[/quote]

  1. Chill, he didn’t kill your mother, he’s giving a quick grammar correction.
  2. I doubt an Asian would have found this site if he can’t speak English. Even so, we would probably ignore him if he posted a question until someone translated it. Heh.

ON TOPIC:
Post your source code where you got the compiling issue. Or post your compiler’s message when you try to compile so that we can try and locate where the issue is occurring.

item.title: 100 errors while complying
item.dc:creator: @jabezxa jabezxa
item.description:
@jabezxa wrote:

title says it all, Any help is very appreciated.
Thanks
Oh and if you said read the topic that is pinned
I did and he doesn’t explain it enough, Where to put it or anything.
100 Errors

This error happens to be a very common problem with beginners. This error is derived from a missing or having too many left or right brace brackets, { and }. 100 errors omit in private servers because that’s the maximum the java compiler will output on default settings.

public class Example {
public int errors() {
return 0;
}

public void moreErrors() {

public static void main(String[] args) {
System.out.println(“This is an example of 100 errors!”);
}
}
This wont throw the legendary 100 errors because the code is to small, but the concept is the same. There is a missing bracket and because of this we get a silly error. Obviously, we need to add another bracket.
Code (Java): [Select]
public class Example {
public int errors() {
return 0;
}

    public void moreErrors() {

    }
   
    public static void main(String[] args) {
            System.out.println("Correct number of brackets!");
    }

}

My Code for complying is
@echo off
title Compiler
“C:/Program Files/Java\jdk1.6.0_22/bin/javac.exe” -d ./bin ./src/*.java
pause

Read full topic
